page.title: 13Bredwardine; Recreation.
page.content: There are no public parks or recreational grounds in the area, although there is a small area of the river bank adjacent to Bredwardine Bridge which has been established by tradition for people to sit and enjoy the scenery. There is a footpath between the bridge and the church and from there to the site of the old Castle. There are other footpaths from the village and Bredwardine Hill to the Knapp. There is no public fishing on the river. The fishing rights are held by land-owners in the district and some are let out to syndicates. It is possible to obtain day-licences from the Red Lion Inn and from Brobury House. Fish found include salmon, trout, pike, perch, eel and chubb.
